concept.label: first-question
concept.phrase: In the <font color="blue">past</font>, <font color="blue">"%prev_foa2%"</font> and <font color="blue">"%prev_foa1%"</font> resulted in <font color="blue">"%prev_i%"</font>, and it was acknowledged as correct. (see <font color="blue">Figure A</font>). <font color="red">Now</font>, I thought <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> and <font color="red">"%current_foa1%"</font> would result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>, but you said that is incorrect. (see <font color="red">Figure B</font>). Why? Please explain your reasoning in the box below.

concept.label: R2-response-simst
concept.phrase: Got it! Thanks!
That's a helpful response. Thanks!
Makes sense to me. Thank you!
Makes sense. Thank you!
That's fair to say. Thank you!
Genius! That helped a lot!
Sweet! Got it!

concept.label: R1-response-simst
concept.phrase: I see! Please explain what went wrong?
How did you figure out that something went wrong?
Oh! I see! What inspired you to say that something is wrong?
Got it! By the way, how did you figure out that something went wrong?

concept.label: R0-response-simst
concept.phrase: I am trying to understand why <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> and <font color="red">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?

I feel like I am missing some crucial information. Can you explain why <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> and <font color="red">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?

I attempt to learn things deeply. How did you know that <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> and <font color="red">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?

I want to solidify my basics. I failed to see why <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> and <font color="red">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>. Can you explain it to me?

I want to strengthen my basic understanding. How did you know that <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> and <font color="red">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?

concept.label: R0-response-simst-2
concept.phrase: Still no luck for me! Would you try one more time to explain why <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> and <font color="red">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?
I am still in doubt! Please explain why <font color="red">"%current_foa2%"</font> and <font color="red">"%current_foa1%"</font> would not result in <font color="red">"%current_i%"</font>?

concept.label: move-on
concept.phrase: Umm...although I am not entirely sure, let’s move on!
Umm...okay, let’s move on for now!
Although I am not sure what you meant, let’s move on!
Okay! Let’s move on, although I’m still confused.
Tough luck, but let’s move on for now!
Hmm...I will get back to it again later. Let’s move on for now!
Umm...I am not very sure what you meant. I will get back to it again later. Let’s move on now!
Although I am not convinced yet, let’s move on for now!
Hmm..I am still confused; I will get back to it later. Let’s move on for now!
Umm..I did not quite get what you said but let me move on for now! I will get back to it later again.

concept.label: unanticipated-response
concept.phrase: anything else
